text: thumb|right|250px|King Water upstream from the ford at West Hall. King Water is a river in the north of Cumbria, England. The Brampton Angling Association has a long term let from the Earl of Carlisle for fishing rights on a portion of the River Irthing and part of the King Water. Hadrian's Wall crossed the King Water to the east of the village of Walton ==References== Category:Rivers of Cumbria 2King
title: King Water
